meanings.definition: A line or mark made by a stroke or blow.
meanings.sent1: She noticed a small streek on the paper where the pen had smudged.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully added a colorful streek to the painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat left a streek of muddy paw prints across the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The lightning left a bright streek across the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The child drew a wavy streek with chalk on the sidewalk.

meanings.sent1: He tried to streek his arms as far as he could reach.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to streek its body when waking up from a nap.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches seemed to streek towards the sky in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to streek endlessly into the distance.
meanings.sent5: She decided to streek her legs before starting her morning run.

meanings.sent1: She used a spatula to streek the icing on the cake.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully streeked the soil before planting the seeds.
meanings.sent3: The warm butter started to streek over the edge of the pan.
meanings.sent4: The paintbrush expertly streeked the colors together on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: He watched the waves streek across the sandy beach.
